value: — the center of the region. Homel preserves several of the finest monuments in Classical style (late 18th-early 19th century) and a number of interesting buildings from later periods.
— a historic town with an unusual city hall from the late 18th century and a few old buildings in Classical style.
— the second largest city in the region, and a rather unremarkable one, although one can find several Catholic churches and secular buildings dating back to the 18th century.
— an old town that is home to the remains of a 12th-century cathedral, one of the largest in ancient Rus'.
— a country estate in art nouveau style
— a natural reserve in the region of Polesia, a swampy and woodland area in the southern part of Belarus
